history.content: You cannot PNP major requirements after this semester. Since ur taking 16B and 61C this semester, you can PNP them if you want to.
You cannot PNP major requirements after this semester. Since ur taking 16B and 61C this semester, you can PNP them if you want to.

children.subject:
Yes you would have to get approved by the current professor of 61C (assuming you mean CS47C, completion of work in CS61C) and EE16B for EECS47E.

You can read about bridge courses here https://engineering.berkeley.edu/students/new-students/bridge-course-instructions/ 

I know somewhat commonly CS47B is taken by transfer students who had datastructures at CC and EECS47D is taken by CS majors who had Math 54, and want to take EECS47D to learn the circuit portion of EECS16A before going on to EECS16B.

For CS47C, I have never heard of anyone taking it.

For EECS47E, I had a few friends take it. They usually already had upper div ee/eecs experience (like EE120, EECS127, etc).

TLDR: you need to have already covered most of the material of a course you want to do a bridge course for in another course.

A followup, how would I go about taking EECS47C or 47E instead of the above classes. Would taking either of these satisfy those particular requirements? Do I need to go through some special process to get approved for these classes?

Thanks

history.content:
I'm a declared LSCS major. In future, non PNP semesters, are we allowed to PNP 61C and EE16B and still graduate? What would happen if we PNP'd these lower division requirements? I PNPd EE16A and satisfied the requirement so was wondering if I could do the same for 61C and 16B

Edit: I have not taken either class yet, not enrolled in either this sem

Thanks
history.subject: PNP 61C or EE16B
